message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.ET. 

The paper presents a new technique for testing software implementations based on refinement types, which are a type of formal specification used in software engineering. This technique is implemented in Haskell and evaluated against state-of-the-art testing approaches. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SE (Software Engineering). Additionally, the paper involves programming languages (cs.PL) and logic (cs.LO) as it uses SMT solvers to generate test cases. It also relates to formal methods (cs.FL) as it provides a gradual path from testing to full verification. Finally, it could be classified under cs.ET (Emerging Technologies) as it presents a novel approach to testing software.
